indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1 Number of hectares of land under CSA practices in the 5 districts 2 Number of schools in the 5 district integrate CSA in their gardens 3 Number of private sector input actors participate in the supply of quality inputs on market. 4 Number of input credit system established per district 5 Number of artisans trained in production of CSA tools 6 Number of producer associations identified, trained and supported to establish SACCOs 7 Lessons on CSA documented 8 Number of CSA technologies for which trials are carried out 9 Number of publication of findings and recommendations

baseline.comment: 1. 2,500 hectares of land under Climate Smart Agriculture practices in target districts 2 No school in the 5 districts integrate CSA 3 1 private sector input actor (Uganda National Agro Inputs Dealers Association) participate in supply of quality inputs on market 4 No input credit system established per district 5 1 artisan (TONNET Enterprise Limited) trained in production of CSA tools 6 No Producer Associations identified, trained and supported to establish Savings and Credit Cooperative Associations. 7 No lessons on CSA documented and disseminated. Limited knowledge management, no clear mechanism for generating and sharing lessons. 8 No trials for CSA technologies carried out 9 No publication of findings and recommendations

target.comment: 1 At least 15,000 hectares put under CSA practices in 5 districts. 2 At least 20 schools in the 5 districts integrate CSA in their gardens. 3 At least 15 private sector actors participate in the supply of quality inputs on market. 4 At least one input credit system established per district. 5 At least 10 artisans trained in production of CSA tools. 6 At least 10 producer associations identified, trained and supported to establish Savings and Credit Cooperative Organisations (SACCOs). 7 Lessons on CSA documented and available for dissemination. 8 Trials on at least four (4) CSA technologies carried out. 9 At least 2 publications of findings and recommendations.

actual.comment: 1 14 hectares (1 Ha per school for 14 schools) put under CSA practices in 5 districts 2 14 schools in the 5 districts integrate CSA in their gardens. 3 6 private sector actors supply quality inputs for CSA upscaling. 4 No input credit system established in the districts 5 10 artisans were identified for production of CSA tools, 6 Five (5) producer associations supported to establish Savings and Credit Cooperative Organizations (SACCOs) 7 Lessons on CSA were neither documented nor made available for disseminated in the year 8 Field Trials on any CSA technologies were not carried out because of bad weather 9 Publications of findings and recommendations were not done because not enough data had been generated

target.comment: 1. At least 10,000 hectares put under CSA practices by 3,500 farmers in the five targeted districts of Bugiri, Busia, Budaka, Namutumba and Buyende. 2. At least 30 schools in the 5 districts integrate CSA in their gardens. 3. 5 private sector actors supply quality inputs for CSA up scaling/to Extend CSA Technologies. 4. At least one input credit system established per district 5. At least 12 artisans trained in production of CSA tools. 6. At least 15 producer associations/private sector actors supported to participate in the supply of quality inputs on market. 7. Lessons on CSA documented and available for dissemination. . 8. Trials on at least four (4) CSA technologies carried out. 9. At least 2 publications of findings and recommendations.

actual.comment: 1. 800 ha was put under CSA practices in the 5 districts 2. 30 schools integrated CSA in their school gardens, particularly conservation agriculture including use of permanent planting basins and mulching for minimum tillage, soil and water conservation structures, early planting and use of improved quality seeds. This activity included 250 girls, 350 boys in the 5 districts. 3. 5 private sector actors supply quality inputs for CSA up scaling/to Extend CSA Technologies. 4. No input credit system established per district. 5. Ten(10) local artisans were trained in fabrication of tools including single rippers, and were equipped with tool boxes and start up kits. 6. At least 20 producer associations/private sector actors participated in the 5 district level platforms set up for interaction between service providers/input suppliers. 7. Lessons on CSA documented and available for dissemination. 8. Trials on at least four (4) CSA technologies were carried out. 9. Two publications of findings and recommendations in plce.
